page.title: 15DALMELLINGTON CHURCH-1
page.content:
Three churches serve the village of Dalmellington. Two are sited outwith our survey area but the parish church lies just within it.
In 1846 this became the third post-Reformation church to serve the parish. It is built of a hard local sandstone which has weathered to a grey colour. Externally it is decorated with Romanesque arcading in relief. The pinnacled tower carries one of the two public clocks in the village; the other is on the front of the primary school at the other side of the township.
The church is sited on high ground on the north-east edge of the village so it overlooks the settlement and is a landmark in the district.
